medical_history.chief_complaint: Shortness of breath, headache, and episode of abnormal body movements with loss of consciousness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Shortness of breath began gradually 12 hours prior to presentation, headache started 3 hours prior, and there was one episode of abnormal body movements with loss of consciousness 1 hour prior to arrival. Associated symptoms included eye rolling, body stiffening, teeth clenching, frothy discharge from the mouth. Symptoms disappeared after intravenous medications.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of obstructive hydrocephalus with recurrent abnormal body movements and respiratory problems since 3 years of age. He underwent herniotomy for a right congenital inguinal hernia at 18 months of age.
medical_history.family_history: There is no known consanguinity in family history.
